documents.document: @macSomairle Thank you - that's very kind of you :-)
@macSomairle Loving the truth of your tweet. You only have to live here at short time to know bins, student flats, hotels and festivals all conspire to worse the views of our wonderful city.

Another in this short series of quotes about #edinburgh and this one sums up Edinburgh perfectly! “This is a city of shifting light, of changing skies, of sudden vistas. A city so beautiful it breaks the heart again and again.” Alexander McCall Smith https://t.co/zdPZ487lCq

@DA_Anderson @thecockburn Oh Donald. Fireworks only last a few hours at Hogmanay when people expect disruption and noise. Thousands of people parking to get to many music events during the year = more misery for local residents.

Jus leave Princess St. Gardens alone. Look at the over commercialism in St. Andrew Square - great currently public space for the city ruined by commercial events in it. Another great thing the BID (biz improvement District) as in 'Essential Edinburgh' has brought us. https://t.co/toRmd0VhFS

@macSomairle @fountainbridge How about no commercial bins allowed on the street. 2 hours to put out for collection. Not overnight. Fines for leave out. This City needs to up its game. FFS. Come on Edinburgh
